titleproper.value: Guide to the Records of the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Science <num>ARC.011</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Flora A. Rodriguez

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-06-13T13:55:24</date>

unittitle.value: Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences records

abstract.value: The Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences evolved from the Brooklyn Apprentices' Library Association formed in 1823, largely through the efforts of Augustus Graham.  In 1825 the Marquis de Lafayette laid the cornerstone of a new building on Washington Street -- a memorable occasion for a young witness named Walt Whitman.  The Library was renamed the Brooklyn Institute in 1843 and remained essentially the same until about 1888 when a greatly expanded program into many branches of science and art was initiated.  Approximately 85% of the collection consists of publications, hard and softbound (including programs and exhibition catalogs), and the remainder correspondence and financial records.  Very few of the materials pre-date the 1890 fire and consolidation; a few of the items surviving include an 1843 exhibition catalog and the 1857 Apprentice's Library catalog, as well as several music programs.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Collection Title, Call or Accession number, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

dsc.value:
Series 1: BIA&S General Administration1857-197312359Scope and ContentsThis series comprises documents pertaining to the General Administration Division of BIA&S. Included are historical documents pertaining to the founding and early development of the institution; acts of incorporation, by-laws, and statements of purpose; annual reports and financial documents originating from the Office of the Treasurer. The materials in this series span the dates 1857-1973.Arrangement

Contained within boxes 1-3, 5, and 9.

Series 2: Education Division1860-19794567810Scope and ContentsThis series comprises materials related to the BIA&S Department of Education. It includes Prospectii of the Department of Education, copies of the weekly Bulletin of the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences, as well as records of the individual departments of the education division. Strongly represented are materials pertaining to the Brooklyn Academy of Music (BAM), including by-laws, correspondence, event programs and calendars, and copies of the Brooklyn Academy of Music Monthly Guide and Review. Also included are records of the Brooklyn Ballet Association, the Women's Committee for the Boston Symphony Orchestra Concerts in Brooklyn, the Tanglewood Excursion, the BIA&S Department of Zoology, and other miscellaneous documents pertaining to the education division.Arrangement

Contained within boxes 4-8, and 10.

Series 3: Museums1843-1976111213Scope and ContentsThe series comprises records of the museums division of BIA&S. Included are correspondence, financial records, catalogs and programs, and other publications. Additionally, there are materials pertaining specifically to the Children's Museum, as well as materials related to the 50th anniversary of the Brooklyn Museum.Arrangement

Contained within boxes 11-13.

Series 4: Brooklyn Botanic Garden1912-192113Arrangement

Contained within box 13.

Scope and Contents

The series includes miscellaneous publications of the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, spanning the dates 1912-1921.
